gurmukhi: sun cMdRBgw kI sBY bqIXw biRKBwn suqw qb AYsy khXo hY ] XwhI ky hyq suno sjnI hm lokn ko auphws shXo hY ]
transliteration: Soun Channdrabhagad Kisabhai Bateeyaa Brikhbhaan Soutaa Tab Aise Kahyo Hai|| Yaahike Het Souno Sajniham Lokan Ko Oup-haas Sahyo Hai||
translation: Hearing the words of chandarbhaga, Radha said to her, “O friend! for this objective, I have endured the ridicules of the people;

gurmukhi: sRaunn mY suin rws kQw qb hI mn mY hm DXwn ghXo hY ] sXwm khY AKIAwN ipK kY hmry mn ko qn moih rhXo hY ]549]
transliteration: Sraounan Mai Soun(i) Raas Kathaa Tab Himan Mai Ham Dhyaan Gadyo Hai|| Syaam Kahai Akheeaan Pikh Kai Hamre Man Ko Tan Moh(i) Rahyo Hai||549||
translation: On listening about the amorous play, my attention is diverted to this side and seeing Krishna with my own eyes, my mind has been fascinated.549.

gurmukhi: qb cMdRBgw ieh BwNiq khXo sjnI hmrI bqIXw suin lIjY ] dyKhu sXwm ibrwjq hY ijh ky muK ky ipKey Pun jIjY ]
transliteration: Tah Channdrabhagad Eh Bhaant(i) Kahyo Sajnihamribateeyaa Soun(i) Leejai|| Dekhoh Syaam Biraajat Hai Jih Ke Moukh Ke Pikhae Phoun Jeejai||
translation: Then Chanderbjhaga said, “O friend! listen to me and see, Krishna is seated there and we all are alive on seeing him;

gurmukhi: jw ky kry imq hoie KuSI sunIAY auT kY soaU kwj krIjY ] qwhI qy rwDy kho qumso Ab cwr BeI qu ibcwr n kIjY ]550]
transliteration: Jaa Ke Dare Mit Hoe Khoushisouneeai Outh Kai Sooo Kaaj Dareejai|| Taahite Raadhe Kaho Toumso Ah Chaar Bhaitu Bichaar Na Keejai||550||
translation: The work, bydoing which the friend is pleased, that work should be done, therefore, O Radha! I am saying to you that now when you have adopted this path, do not have other thoughts in your mind”.550.

gurmukhi: kwnH ky Bytn pwie clI bqIXw sun cMdRBgw Pun kYsy ] mwnhu nwg suqw ieh suMdr iqAwg clI giH pqR DrYsy ]
transliteration: Kaahn Ke Bhetan Paae Chalibateeyaa Soun Channdrabhagad Phoun Kaise|| Maanoh Naag Soutaa Eh Soundar Tiaag Chaligrih Patra Ddaraise||
translation: Radha started on listening to the words of Chandarbhaga for the attainment of Krishna and she appeared like a Naga-damsel leaving her home;

gurmukhi: gÍwrn mMdr qy inksI kib sXwm khY aupmw iqh AYsy ] mwnhu sXwm GnY qij kY pRgtI hY soaU ibjulI duiq jYsy ]551]
transliteration: Gvaaran Mandar Te Niksikabi Syaam Kahai Oupmaa Tih Aise|| Maanoh Syaam Ghanai Taj(i) Kai Pragadihai Sooo Bijulidout(i) Kaise||551||
translation: Giving the simile of the gopis coming out of the temple, the poet has said that they look like the manifestation of the creepers of lightning, leaving the clouds.551.

gurmukhi: rwsih kI rcnw Bgvwn khY kib sXwm bicqR krI hY ] rwjq hYN qrey jmunw Aiq hI qh cwNdnI cMd krI hY ]
transliteration: Raasah(i) Kirachnaa Bhagvaan Kahai Kabisyaam Bachitra Karihai|| Raajat Hai Tarae Jamounnda At(i) Hitah Chaandanichannd Karihai||
translation: Lord Krishna has created the arena of amorous play in a wonderful way; down below, Yamuna is flowing with currents like moonshine;

gurmukhi: syq ptY sMg rwjq gÍwrn qw kI pRBw kib ny su krI hY ] mwnhu rws bgIcn mY ieh PUln kI Pulvwr jrI hY ]552]
transliteration: Set Padai San Raajat Gvaaran Taa Kiprabhaa Kab(i) Ne Su Karihai|| Maanoh Raas Bageechanndmai Eh Phoolan Kiphulvaar Jarihai||552||
translation: The gopis look splendid in white garments and they appear like a flower-garden in the forest of amorous play.552.

gurmukhi: cMdRBgw hUM ko mwn khXo biRKBwn suqw hir pwien lwgI ] mYn sI suMdr mUrq pyiK kY qwhI ky dyiKby ko AnurwgI ]
transliteration: Channdrabhagad Hoon Ko Maan Kahyo Brikhbaan Soutaa Har(i) Paaeen Laagee|| Main Sisoundar Moondat Pekh(i) Kai Taahike Dekh(i)be Ko Anuraagee||
translation: Obeying Chandarbhaga, Radha touched the feet of Krishna; she merged like a charming portrait in Krishna on seeing him;
